title: Urging the United States Army Corps of Engineers to undertake emergency dredging at Montauk Harbor inlet
fulltext:
LEGISLATIVE  RESOLUTION urging the United States Army Corps of Engineers
to undertake emergency dredging at Montauk Harbor inlet

WHEREAS, The shoaling at the inlet into the mouth of Montauk Harbor  has
grown  more  dangerous because of this winter's series of severe storms;
and
  WHEREAS, The ingress  and  egress  of  commercial  fishing  and  other
vessels  into  and  out of Montauk Harbor is seriously affected by these
increasingly dangerous conditions affecting both the  public  safety  as
well as the local economy; and
  WHEREAS,  Shoaling  in Montauk Harbor inlet has become a chronic prob-
lem; in 1999, and again the following year, the shoal grounded the drag-
gers, First Light and Jason and Danielle; the First Light was  destroyed
and the Jason and Danielle narrowly escaped capsizing; and
  WHEREAS, After the Jason and Danielle near tragedy, the inlet received
its  first  major dredging in years; approximately 48,000 cubic yards of
sand were pumped from the channel  and  deposited  along  the  beach  at
Soundview; and
  WHEREAS,  The  Montauk  Harbor  inlet was dredged in 2004 and again in
2009; and
  WHEREAS, In order to resolve the problem at the Montauk Harbor  inlet,
dredging  needs to be undertaken to restore safe navigation of the chan-
nel and sand bypassing must be undertaken to remove the glut of sand  on
the  East  side of the inlet to mitigate the impact of its flow into the
Montauk Harbor; such material obtained from dredging and sand  bypassing
must  be  deposited  to  restore the beaches on the Soundview side which
have eroded due to the blockage of the natural flow of  sand  caused  by
the inlet; and
  WHEREAS,  The  next dredging of the Montauk Harbor inlet by the United
States Army Corps of Engineers is not scheduled until 2013; and
  WHEREAS, Emergency dredging by the United States Army Corps  of  Engi-
neers  of  the Montauk Harbor inlet will not only ease the public safety
concerns of the commercial fishing industry but also provide relief  for
the property owners suffering from increasing erosion west of the inlet;
now, therefore, be it
  RESOLVED,  That  this  Legislative  Body pause in its deliberations to
respectfully urge the United States Army Corps of Engineers to undertake
emergency dredging and sand bypassing at Montauk Harbor inlet  with  the
placement of the material generated by dredging and sand bypassing to be
used to restore the beaches on the Soundview side; and be it further
  RESOLVED, That a copy of this Resolution, suitably engrossed, be tran-
smitted to the United States Army Corps of Engineers.
